intro: Stelleropsis, commonly known as the star-shaped plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, star-like inflorescence composed of numerous small, tubular flowers. The leaves are typically narrow and grass-like, arranged in a basal rosette. Stelleropsis species are native to various regions in the Americas, particularly in arid and semi-arid environments. These plants are often adapted to survive in harsh conditions, showcasing resilience and unique botanical features.
